hl.seg: Tea: Effective cure of breast Cancer?

doc.seg: New research indicates that drinking 3 cups of tea everyday
reduces the danger of breast cancer in women under 50 years of age by 1/3rd.

The research done at the Moffitt Cancer Center in the American State of Florida, showed that chances of getting breast cancer is reduced by 37% in those women under 50 years of age who drink at least three cups of tea everyday.
The research also indicates that it does not help older women, even if they drink three or more cups of tea daily.
Specialists think that this is because of the presence of such components in tea that are more effective against such types of cancer tumors, which usually targets women under 50 years of age.
Research was done on 5000 women who had treatment done for chest cancer at Moffitt Cancer Center, founded in Tampa, Florida.
Their ages are between 20 and 74 years.
Specialists compared their medical records and lifestyles to those women who are free from chest cancer.
Specialists also came to know that tea had its prominent effect on one kind of cancer, Lobes, and it was reduced by 66%.
One out of ten chest cancer cases is such.
This type of chest cancer is dangerous because it is deep inside and usually diagnosed when it has spread a lot.
Specialists say that having at least three cups of tea every day can readily reduce the chances of chest cancer in women of lesser age.
They say that incorporating tea as a regular drink in your daily routine helps create immunity against the cancer.
Almost 40,000 women are diagnosed with chest cancer in Britain.

hl.seg: Why Reduce Exercise With Age?
New Research

doc.seg: Exercise at any age is good for your health.
It energizes your heart, reduces cholesterol levels, helps in keeping weight low, helps to prevent diabetes and slows down the process of Alzheimer's or dementia.
Unfortunately the ability to exercise decreases for many people as they age.
Experts say that exercise keeps our body and brain active however age can affect it.
According to the American Medical Association, several health related problems can arise from not doing exercise.
Dr. Patricia Palecca of Mayo Clinic, Minnesota says that an increase in age is a major cause of inability to excercise and lack of bodily activity.
Dr. Palecca teaches medicine at the Mayo Clinic.
She lead a study of how heart related diseases and the ability to exercise is related to old age.
The team of doctors used high frequency sound waves to measure the mechanics of the heart.
In which the pumping of the blood by the heart, its contraction and relaxation was studied.
The experts focussed on the left part of the heart which is the main part for pumping blood.
They learned that as people grew old, there was an increase in faults in the relaxation of the heart.
Dr. Palecca says that as age increases, the faults in the relaxation of the heart begin to appear, and this affects the ability to exercise.
Dr. Garwin Cain was also a part of this study.
He says that we were surprised to see that there is a definite effect of this. And this clearly proves how deep a relation the worsening of exercise has with the relaxation of the heart.
Sometimes blood pressure can be a cause of heart disease, as it can cause complications in the working of the heart.
If the doctor and patent work together they can achieve the benefits of exercise despite the patients advanced age.
A more detailed report on these complications and treatments has been published in the American Medical Association's magazine.
